reviews.review_msg: You will be hard pressed to find an economics instructor with as much passion and enthusiasm as Francis. He embraces real world applications and effectively teaches outside of the text when its relevant. Whether you are interested in economics or not, his classroom breeds problem solving that can be applied to everything else in school and life.
Unclear at the time of teaching. Not very respectful
Juz.........poor teaching skills, i think he need time to prove

If you study, use your brain, you will fly through this course. He is very perceptive to how the class is doing, and will alter his teaching accordingly (and change how difficult he makes his tests), be patient and you'll reap alllll the benefits! Helps in office hours and gives very clear hints for exams. Attend class! Funny & French!

He can be difficult to understand and can go on tangents otherwise, he is not a bad prof. In Econ 104 there is minimal work and the exams were nearly identical to his study guide. Provided you put the work in, it is an easy GPA boost and a good elective.
Basil is good, but his Chinese TA is the worst. If u had him, and his TA is Chinese avoid him as much as u can. Otherwise, Basil is super good.

The course content itself was incredibly easy. This made sitting through a 3 hour lecture tedious, as he explains concepts that could be grasped in 10 minutes over 2 hours. Seems like a nice guy, but as a professor - he wasn't amazing. Also wasn't a fan of the short answer exams. Made the marking subjective to the TAs.
This prof's hilarious. Really interesting guy, very good at teaching his classes. Makes lectures interesting. Super easy going. 10/10 would take his class again
Much better than expected.

Vasyl was my prof and my TA. Lectures were a bit dry, but the material was very interesting. He is very approachable & helpful. Tutorials were a bit more scary than lectures. Exams were easy, since we had prior knowledge of the exam questions that were from the 300+ study questions we were given from week 1. Glad I took this course with Vasyl.
The material itself is not too bad but the prof is very hard to understand. Lectures were disorganized and dry. I would recommend avoiding this prof if possible. The TA was very helpful, however.
Horrible lectures, boring and disorganized. Attendance steadily decreased to about 30% by november. AVOID AT ALL COSTS
hard to understand!

He doesn't explain anything well. If you ask him to explain something he doesn't answer questions. His exams are based on sample questions he gives you, which seems easy, but his marking is ridiculous! He will mark something wrong for one student and mark it right for another student even when they wrote the exact same thing! Try and avoid this pro

Very strong accent.  Midterm and final was very similar to homework and tutorial questions, although very specific.  Read the textbooks and lecture notes, although stronger emphasis on textbook reading in this course.  Attend tutorial.  The TA: Rajar was very good.

Krishna was a great professor, he allows cheat sheets in all his exams. I was able to get an A without really studying my butt off. Pay close attention and watch lecture recordings and add to your notes. The details you need to know to do super well in his class are not really in the lecture slides themselves but in what he says during lectures.
Great professor and great class; would highly recommend to anyone looking for a basic understanding of economics, especially if you aren't an ECON major.

Krishna provides a comprehensive view of the world of economics and his lectures were engaging due to that reason. Also, his open teaching style made lectures enjoyable. My one complaint is that there could be an awful lot of reading. He also said that if you have a background in economics that this course would be a waste of time, but it was not.
Never a dull moment in a Pendakur class. Greatest lecturer at SFU, not up for debate. Long live the king

This course was excellent, and that's a large part due to Krishna's lectures.

The highlight for me was the lecture on carbon taxes. It was fascinating to experience through the lecture and MobLab how carbon taxes are an efficient form of carbon reduction. I've legit relistened to the lecture like 3 times cuz I enjoyed it so much.

He is hilarious - by far one of the most interesting professors at SFU. Class was very laid back. The topics he covers are super important and many aren't covered in other economics courses. He explains things in a non-technical way which is good for economics and non-economics students. Super fair exams and always available for extra help. A+++

The class is very easy (attend every lecture and you're guaranteed to pass). Krishna himself is vey passionate about the material but he's unorganized in the way the lectures are structured. If you've done any econ classes before probably avoid, as this class is insanely boring and the content is pretty dry and won't further your econ knowledge.

He's a phenomenal prof. Lectures are interesting easy to understand with his explanation. He assigns lots of papers but goes through all the key concepts in class. 

Also, 40% of your grade is essentially attendance so if you just go to class your almost guaranteed a pass.

He's a wonderful prof! Super funny and approachable, and very clear about what his exams are like. For the midterm and final, MAKE SURE you do the practice midterms that he provides AND go on his online website with past exams and lecture notes, as one portion will be identical to the set of questions and the other portion will be very similar.
Super super easy class if you have taken econ 103!! I skipped half of the classes and ended with an A. Just read over his slides and assigned readings then you will be fine!

Dr. Pendakur is very laid back, and an excellent professor for first year students. That being said, his lecture structure is very poor and the concepts he teaches are very abstract. You would expect an economics course to be concrete, but he tries to avoid graphs and equations as much as possible, and his clarity sometimes suffers as a result.

Great class, Great Teacher!! He makes the class fun, the notes interesting, and he's really helpful. All you have to do is take some notes, read the book and attend tutorials. I barely read the book and still got an A. 5 mini-assignments, easyily marked. Chiller prof, sometimes hyperactive speaker. NO econ backround needed,class reccomended to all!

Insane amounts of reading, novel/courseware/extra they are long and parts of it are tested in midterms and finals. Class notes only help a little. Assignments almost every other week, and those require you to read more extra which arent too too bad.
Awesome teacher, he makes his lectures and otherwise seemingly boring material interesting. Funny guy and really helpful, I would definitely take his course again.

I love this prof! Hes is so entertaining. The only complaint I would have would be the emmense amount of reading that is required. Also, the T.A's mark all of your work, not the prof, so your grade really depends on your T.A.

One of the coolest, most interesting and captivating proofs in the friecken universe! Before taking this class I had never fathomed that economics would be so interesting. I have turned into a believer.
easiest group requirement there is. fun course and really easy. he's a hippy though so beware of left wing crazyness.

he is really fun guy... the lectures are often entertaining... but lots and lots of readings... in terms of grading, it really depends on your TA because he/she is the one that does ALL the markings... I had an okay TA so our class avg was avg... the other class had a easier TA so their avg was slightly higher... overall, nice class...

very interesting class and the prof is a great guy. Do not read the textbook because it's so boring and useless, just read the novel as it has every single concept of this course written in plain language. It's actually very difficult to get lower than B if you attend all the lectures and read the novel.

He is a great prof! He gives interesting lectures and everything he talks about is related to the final/midterm. You will do good in his class if you attend lectures, go to tutorials, and read his notes. I didn't find the textbooks all that useful and make sure you ask the TA's for help when needed...they are great!

very hyperactive prof, he talks so darn fast. swears a lot, makes references to the weirdest films. haha, overall pretty fun prof, class material isn't too deep, as long as u know the few concepts that he goes over u'll do fine

Cool Laid back, easy going, what can I say.  My only complaint is he tends to swear alot.  Learned a tremendous amount and he was fair.  What do you expect from a guy who graduated his Ph.d from berkeley.
he is kinda werid, but overall a pretty cool guy!! no econ background needed to take this course!!
cool guy, gret teacher
his classes were never boring...if you read ur stuff and listen to the lectures and the TA :P its not hard to get a gud grade....altho i never expected id get an A+ LOlz....

Prof. Pendakur is an outgoing person, but the materials are too confusing for anyone who does not have an economics background. There was also a lot of reading, a majority of which was beyond the reasonable comprehension of first-year students. I probably would have regretted taking the course had I not receive the grade which I did!

not a hard working or smart student. i read the comments before taking the course. expected a B and got an A-. studied 2 days before mts & exam. key to doing well are read text, lectures, read notes posted online, tutorials and nice, lenient TAs. he was great at teaching and attending his lectures wasn't so bad. fun dude

Govt&Econ - found out via TA middle of the sem. the course is not about govt/econ but about insurance, healthcare OTHER. TOO MUCH READING. Midterms TOO LONG. The only 'easy' marks were assignments. He thinks students who leave early in midterm means the MT must be easy for student. Can't the student leave early cause he gave up on the MT? U get C-.
It is not as easy as the rate showed.  Getting a B is hard.  Two much reading stuff.  Focus more on his notes, and do not write on your own opinion, just write what he likes.

Pendakur's gotten harder people. I think he's been reading these messages and taking them in consideration. The average for of the first exams of the fall semester was 23/40, which is roughly 58%. With 6 A's in this class on the second midterm and 23 F's, I don't see you anyone can "BS" this stuff. If you think you can, you're sorely mistaken.
Fun teacher and very engaging. I find a lot of noted aren't necessary. A bit confusing with all the graphs and lots of reading. Overall cool guy :)
good teacher, interesting class, snappy dresser
easyclass, easy to undersatand seems really inyo his subject the work load was mild, however an A was extremely hard to acheive.

krishna's classes were clear and enthusiastic. To the person who said all you had to do was make up a whole lot of BS, obviously you didn't in any way try for the whole experience in this class. In any way i hope you fail in life if that is your theory to follow by. Krishna taught well and, at no time, did making up some BS look as a good option.
Krishna is the youngest econ professor and he really makes his course interresting. If you're good at making up "BS" that makes sense, you will probably do good.

Trust me! Econ 103+105 is highly recommended before this course. If you are good at "BS", this is a course for you. As the one before said, "B" range is easy to get, "A" is near impossible and he won't curve
No Comments

Tons of readings! (You cannot find a courseware from bookstore that has more pages than this course, and You MUST read). Readings & Lecture notes are not related at all. Easy to hit 'B' range but very difficult to hit 'A' range.
Most relaxed prof at the school.
he was so cool that i thought he was cool beyond belief. beyond snappy dresser ruler of the wardrobe!
Great prof, very funny and engaging, and very easy to talk to. If you take this class for what it is - a basic intro econ course - you can really learn a lot.

easy class. of the few times I went to lecture, Krishna seemed very enthusiastic and interested in the material (which makes sense since he created the course from scratch). Very animated in speech and movement, but somewhat messy notes.

He is very enthusiastic which helps keep me awake.  He likes to crack jokes and use funny examples.  This class was not very hard because it was kind of a mean nothing class.  I would definetly take another class with Krishna.

In the beginning of the semester, I thought this guy was really nice and the class was easy.But when I actually went to get one-on-one help, he was an a$$!He's totally biased to his students.If he likes u then he's really nice to u but if he doesn't,then you won't be getting any help for the rest of the semester! BIASED!!

He's great prof! Very clear, explains everything important from the readings. Definitely not a boring class he always kept me interested and focused. His notes were very helpful. The Qs from the midterm were EXACTLY the same as the notes and Qs in tutorial. Attend class...do the readings and participate in tutorial and it's all that it takes!!!
Josh is a nice guy. I believe he is always there for his students.

Class not that hard but also not that easy. if you haven't done econ before there is a combination of both math and writing involved in this course. Assignments were an easy pass, but the exams were difficult and timed very short. The prof however is really nice though.
Very good prof. Super nice and helpful. Genuinely wants his students to succeed. Assignments and tests were very straightforward with fair marking.
If you read in her class, there is no need to go to lectures or tutorials tbh.

Honestly, one of the most frustrating classes I've ever taken. Farhad is super disorganized, speaks bad English and has a strong accent and half the time he just reads off the slides without actually explaining the material. If you ask a question, he either brushes it off or gives a super confusing answer.
